intro: Osmorhiza berteroi var. gracilior, commonly known as slender boneset, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, rich soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its historical use by Native American tribes for medicinal purposes highlights its ecological and cultural significance.
